name: Permuting Pixels to Target

Tries to permute the pixels from one source image (iChannel0) to best fit another target image (iChannel1).
The respective channels are both to be found in the tab for buffer A.

The sim might have to be restarted so that the init may occur correctly.

name: Fo Reproject cam refract laser
author: ollj
description:
Camera controls are WASD and QE for roll.
N shoots a beam. R reset accumulation.

Storing a light path and then using it for next event estimation in path tracing,the NEE is importance sampled so that the probability of hitting a light path is maximized.

name: Fractal 71_gaz
author: gaz
description: fractal

name: 2d ray marching 4d objects-Demo
author: xertrov
description:
How do you ray march a 4d object?
This is the best method I've found so far (earlier attempts on my page). It works for general 4d SDFs. Lots of options if you want to play. criticism and suggestions v welcome.

name: 2d ray marching - 3d sandbox
author: xertrov
description:
This is a tool shader I wrote while writing a more complex shader to do 2d ray marching of 4d objects (this was simpler + let me test 3d shapes before 4d ones).
2d ray marching produces a projection -- so 2d ray marching a 3d scene gives back a 1d image

name: Bidirectional Tracer Reproj
author: michael0884
description:
Camera controls are WASD and QR for roll. R reset accumulation. N to shoot a ray.
Storing a light path and then using it for next event estimation in path tracing, the NEE is importance sampled so that the probability of hitting a light path is maximized.

name: Loki - Miss minutes

description:
Code is perfectible but it runs kinda find for what it is :).
I'm really proud of this one, I spent about 8 hours to make it but it's worth it.
Hope you'll appreciate it.

name: 3D Volume (Noise) Visualizer
author: mrmcsoftware
description: Just a simple shader to show what's in shadertoy's 3d noise volumes.  Let the shader automatically, repeatedly run through all 32 "slices" or drag mouse in left-right direction to manually select slice.  I wrote this to diagnose my own shader program.

name: Ray Tracing One Weekend Improved
author: chenglou
description:
Revisited my original ray tracer from the beginning of the month! Speed went from 11 fps to 55 fps :)
- Way better random in unit sphere & vector & disk
- Unrolled the loop from `hit`
- Removed a few conditionals. That's it!

name: Chaos Wheel
author: oneshade
description:
An excuse to improve my understanding of rotation physics.
Recreation of the cool animation from this video: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6z4qRhpBIyA[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6z4qRhpBIyA[/url]
common_code:
// Constants
#define PI 3.14159265359
#define TAU 6.28318530718

// Settings
#define BUCKETS 8.0
#define BUCKET_SIZE vec2(0.08, 0.15)

#define WHEEL_RADIUS 0.3
#define SPOKE_WIDTH 0.015
#define WHEEL_DENSITY 0.02

// â«r^2dm = â«â«(x^2+y^2)âdyâdx (x in range [0...WHEEL_RADIUS] and y in range [-SPOKE_WIDTH/2...SPOKE_WIDTH/2])
#define WHEEL_INERTIA ((4.0 * SPOKE_WIDTH * pow(WHEEL_RADIUS, 3.0) + pow(SPOKE_WIDTH, 3.0) * WHEEL_RADIUS) / 12.0 * BUCKETS)

#define WHEEL_FRICTION 0.95

#define FILL_RATE 0.018
#define DRAIN_RATE 0.0015
#define FLUID_DENSITY 0.02

#define GRAVITY 0.1

name: Improved Tesseract
author: xertrov
description:
so far, the best method I've found to render 4d objects is to just sample the W axis multiple times.
I tried 2-step ray marching too, i.e., ray march in Z then, at the minimum, ray march in W. That should be better but I had some issues w that method.

name: Continuous Factorial (Alt.)
author: oneshade
description:
Alternative approximation for both positive and negative values using Euler's reflection formula:
gamma(x)gamma(1-x) = (x - 1)!(-x)! = pi/sin(pi*x)
I think I have been incorrectly calling this gamma but the factorial is actually gamma(x-1).

name: Pow() Bug
author: oneshade
description:
pow() has the wrong sign cube roots and also seems to be wrong for odd exponents and roots.
Red is pow(x, 1/3), green is corrected pow(x, 1/3)

name: Lattice Parametrization II
author: spr
description:
Lattice with Voronoi cells. Uses LLL for lattice reduction. Modular Surface /  Space of Lattices
Controls:
a/z expand x-direction & contract y-direction (geodesic flow)
s/x & f/v shear (horocycle flow)
d/c rotate (rotation of unit tangent vector)

name: Apple Logo SDF

description:
Apple logo uses cubic bezier. This approximates it to a high fidelity with only circles + smoothing. Maybe it's better to just use the cubic beziers?

See comment for details. Original sizes at https://www.shadertoy.com/view/NtsXRM

name: Apple Logo SDF Draft
author: chenglou
description:
Apple logo uses cubic bezier. This closely approximates it with only circles + smoothing. Maybe it's better to just use the cubic beziers?

name: Grid of Cylinders reactive

description: Using a 2D regular grid as acceleration structure for raytracing (an infinite amount of) cylinders. I trace across the 2D grid and then intersect the cylinder inside each cell. When the first intersection is found, the tracing can stop.

name: Fork Cubic Bezi brickmaker 655
author: brickmaker
description: Computing the exact bounding box to a cubic Bezier curve. Yellow: naive bbox of the 4 control points. Blue: exact/analytic bbox. Since the bezier is cubic, the bbox can be compute with a quadratic equation.

name: Class I Goldberg Polyhedron
author: Lichtso
description:
UV-mapped hexagonal tiling on an icosahedron, See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goldberg_polyhedron

Instead of mesh tessellation this shader uses voronoi cells.
This way the performance is independent of the number of tiles.

name: Particle System Base
author: SpinningCube
description:
basic particle code to be expanded on, storing position and velocity. Fullscreen is broken for some reason, I haven't found an explanation for the behavior there.

reset it to add more particles
common_code:
#define getParticlePos(num) texelFetch(iChannel0, ivec2(mod(float(num*2), iResolution.x), num*2 / int(iResolution.x)), 0).xy
#define getParticleVel(num) texelFetch(iChannel0, ivec2(mod(float(num*2), iResolution.x) + 1., num*2 / int(iResolution.x)), 0).xy

name: foliage shadow with fake convol2
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
Procedural variant of https://shadertoy.com/view/stlXzN
foliage shadowing requires convolution with (solar) disk scaled with distance to floor.
Here I approximate this with SDF to foliage mask. That I approximate with MIPmap of mask.
common_code:
#define R         iResolution.xy
#define T( U, l ) textureLod( iChannel0, (U)/R , l ).x

name: foliage shadow with fake convolu
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
foliage shadowing is equivalent to DoF Boket : requires convolution with (solar) disk scaled with distance to floor.
Here I approximate this with SDF to foliage mask. That I approximate with MIPmap of mask.
( try uncommenting some foliage motion. WIP ).
common_code:
#define R         iResolution.xy
#define T( U, l ) textureLod( iChannel0, (U)/R , l ).x

name: isolines in MIPmapped mask
author: FabriceNeyret2
description: funny patterns I got why looking for something totally else. :-)
common_code:
#define R         iResolution.xy
#define T( U, l ) textureLod( iChannel0, (U)/R , l )

name: Naive AA vs Exact blend
author: pyBlob
description: Representing subpixel coverage as transparency for antialiasing assumes that background subpixels are covered independently. In the extreme case (left circle), the covered foreground subpixels exactly match the covered background subpixels.

name: Ray Tracing One Weekend

From [url]https://raytracing.github.io/books/RayTracingInOneWeekend[/url]. A path tracer. Ported it over almost verbatim.
Animated it for stress testing speed. No temporal AA hack
Much improved version at [url]https://www.shadertoy.com/view/7tBXDh[/url]

name: Mandelbrot Set Pixel Counting
author: oneshade
description:
Using mipmaps to count the pixels in the mandelbrot set. Reference: [url=https://www.shadertoy.com/view/Ml2cDm]https://www.shadertoy.com/view/Ml2cDm[/url]
To get a better measurement in actual units, you'll need to manually set PIXEL_AREA.

name: Bounce lighting test
author: fraser
description: I'm currently having some issues where convergence still has banding (even with uv noise enabled), but that could easily just be that my random-functions are a bit lacking
